summary: Limonene is a colorless liquid found in the peels of citrus fruits like lemons and oranges. It has a pleasant orange fragrance and is often used as a flavoring agent in food. This hydrocarbon is also useful in chemical synthesis and as a solvent in cleaning products. The two main isomers of limonene are (+)-limonene, which is commonly found in nature and has a pleasant fragrance, and (-)-limonene, which has a turpentine-like odor and is found in plants like caraway and dill. The name 'limonene' comes from the Italian word for lemon.
title: Limonene
